titleStmt.title: J. F. Stephenson to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG6938

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Albany Ky Aug the 23rd 1865
E. L. Vanwinkle
Sect of State
Dear Sir,

I inclose coppy of the Indictment and $2, the fee, for making the papers and if there is any other charges inform me and I will send the call immediately. the amount of the Bond is $300.00 three hundred Dollars. Mr Vanwinkel, you will pleas forward the papers to me, and I will go to James-town, and attend to the matter myself. pleas do not delay as I am anxious to get it up in due time, and I will be under many Obligations to you

I Remain Respectfully
your obdt, Servt,
Jas F. Stephenson
Capt Co "E" S. C.
Batt.
P, S, I guess it will be proper to make out the papers on the name of James.M. Stephenson as the indictment appies to me and gives my name that match sons.
